items.title: ChatLoopBackOff: Episode 68 (KANISTER)
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Join us LIVE as CNCF Ambassador Carlos Santana dives into Kanister, the open source framework for application-level data management on Kubernetes.

Carlos will be exploring the project for the very first time, right alongside you. Expect a hands-on walkthrough of the docs, community resources, and real-world use cases that highlight how Kanister helps extend Kubernetes for backup, recovery, and data operations.

If you’re curious about how cloud native projects approach complex data management challenges, or just enjoy watching an experienced open source explorer break down a CNCF project live, this session is for you.

Bring your questions, share your experiences, and learn in real time as we explore Kanister together!</article>

items.title: ChatLoopBackOff: Episode 67 (Kserve)
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Join us LIVE as CNCF Ambassador Shivay Lamaba dives into KServe, the open source project designed for scalable and reliable ML models serving on Kubernetes.

Shivay will be  exploring the project for the very first time, right alongside you. Expect a hands-on walkthrough of the docs, community resources, and real-world use cases that make KServe a key piece in the cloud native AI/ML ecosystem.
If you’re curious about production-grade model inference, want to see how cloud native communities approach machine learning workloads, or just enjoy watching an experienced open source explorer break down a CNCF project live, this session is for you.

Bring your questions, share your experiences, and learn in real time as we explore KServe together!</article>

items.title: CNL: Network-level and Identity-based Observability with Calico Open Source
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Don't let your Kubernetes environment be a mystery! Gain the visibility you need to keep things running smoothly. This session dives into why network observability is key in Kubernetes, and includes a live demo showing how to identify misconfigurations, simplify troubleshooting, streamline overall network management, and safely implement and test network security policies across any Kubernetes environment.

Here's what we'll explore:

* Why network observability is important (hint: Kubernetes can be a bit chaotic! )
* How observability is the foundation for zero trust security
* Common customer pain points: Troubleshooting, incorrect policies, compliance, and audits
* Calico Whisker: What it is and how it provides that crucial bird's-eye view
* LIVE DEMO: Cluster-wide network observability using Calico Whisker</article>

items.title: CNL: Bringing Agentic AI to Cloud Native with kagent & Kyverno
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content: <article>Let’s stop babysitting clusters and build AI agents to operate and govern for us! Kagent, a new CNCF project, enables simple declarative development of Kubernetes-native AI agents for any cloud native projects. This session will show you how to rapidly construct custom AI agents for essential operational and management tasks. Learn how Kyverno, the Kubernetes-native policy engine for managing validation, mutation, generation, and cleanup, can be extended with AI capabilities through kagent using the emerging Model Context Protocol (MCP) to enable intelligent policy recommendations and automation.</article>

items.title: CNCF Deaf and Hard of Hearing Working Group at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon EU 2025
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Huge shout-out to the CNCF Deaf and Hard of Hearing Working Group for an incredible week at KubeCon + CloudNativeCon in London earlier this year! Check out this latest video to get a glimpse of what they were up to and what to expect in Atlanta!

They brought so much energy and had lots of activities, including a keynote, several talks, and a fun sign language crash course. Their kiosk in the Project Pavilion was a hub of activity, creating meaningful connections and fostering a more inclusive community.

This group is full of passion and brilliant people. We're so proud of what they've accomplished, and look forward to seeing the team in Atlanta! And for a fun challenge, watch the video and see if you can spot the new sign they created for "CNCF." ✨</article>

items.title: ChatLoopBackOff: Episode 65 (Kubean)
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content: <article>Ready to simplify Kubernetes cluster management across hybrid or multi-cloud environments? In this Live demo, CNCF Ambassador Afzal Ansari explores Kubean, a CNCF project that brings an Ansible-powered, GitOps-friendly approach to Kubernetes operations. Kubean aims to streamline the full lifecycle management of Kubernetes clusters—provisioning, upgrading, scaling, and decommissioning—using declarative configurations and a plugin-based architecture. Afzal will walk through the project’s core components, check out its integration with tools like Cluster API and OpenKruise, and assess its community momentum and production readiness. If you're interested in scalable cluster automation with a flexible control plane, don’t miss this first look at what Kubean has to offer.</article>

items.title: CNCF On demand webinar: Troubleshooting Kubernetes with confidence
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content: <article>Kubernetes debugging remains one of the most frustrating and time-consuming challenges in cloud native operations. When production issues hit, even seasoned platform engineers and SREs can find themselves grasping at logs, manually exec-ing into pods, and relying on shallow output from kubectl describe. In this conversational session, we sit down with Alban the creator of Traceloop and a core contributor to Inspektor Gadget, to explore how modern debugging is evolving, and what’s next. You’ll get a behind-the-scenes look at how Traceloop introduces kubectl-native tracing, powered by eBPF, to bring retroactive debugging into real-world Kubernetes clusters. Whether you're maintaining uptime, resolving incidents, or building internal tooling, this session will give you the practical insight and tools you need to troubleshoot Kubernetes with clarity and confidence.</article>

items.title: Cloud Native Live - Kyverno 1.15: New Policy Types
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Join us next week for a follow-up session where we explore the new policy types introduced in Kyverno 1.15 — MutatingPolicies, DeletingPolicies, and GeneratingPolicies.

This builds on our previous session, where we discussed Kyverno’s shift to CEL and introduced ValidatingPolicies and ImageValidatingPolicy. We’ll dive into how these new policies work, use cases they unlock, and how they fit into the future of Kubernetes policy management.</article>

items.title: Get ready to relive the energy of KubeCon + CloudNativeCon Japan 2025! 🇯🇵
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>From June 16-17, the cloud-native community came together in Tokyo for two days of groundbreaking talks, innovative demos, and unforgettable connections. This highlight video captures the excitement, insights, and collaboration that made this event a huge success. Thanks to everyone who joined us in person and virtually—we can't wait to see you at the next one!

🎥 You can watch all 80+ session videos now here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj6h78yzYM2PsNdcBGWR_mVN-SRLQl6KM

#KubeCon #CloudNative #Kubernetes #KubeConJapan #CNCF</article>

items.title: Keynote: Champions of Cloud Native: Stories and Insights from CNCF Ambassadors - Panel
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Don't miss out! Join us at our next Flagship Conference: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America in Atlanta (November 10-13). Connect with our current graduated, incubating, and sandbox projects as the community gathers to further the education and advancement of cloud native computing. Learn more at https://kubecon.io

Keynote: Champions of Cloud Native: Stories and Insights from CNCF Ambassadors - Monika Rajput, Ahead LLC; Divya Mohan, SUSE; Daniel Oh, Red Hat; Kimberly Falk, CNCF

The CNCF Ambassador Program brings together passionate community leaders who drive the cloud native movement forward through education, advocacy, and collaboration. In this keynote panel, we spotlight the voices behind the program, CNCF Ambassadors who have made meaningful contributions to the ecosystem.

Panelists will share their personal journeys: what inspired them to become Ambassadors, the challenges they’ve overcome, and the impact they’ve made. We’ll explore the tangible benefits of being part of the program, the knowledge they’ve gained, and how they continue to empower others in the community. Attendees will also hear first-hand advice for those aspiring to become future Ambassadors, and discover why these leaders play a vital role in the growth and success of the CNCF community worldwide.

Join us for an inspiring conversation that celebrates community, leadership, and the heart of the cloud native movement.</article>

items.title: Keynote: From Grass to Glass: Chitale Dairy's App Tra... Vishvas Parshuram Chitale & Dilpreet Bindra
items.author: CNCF [Cloud Native Computing Foundation]
items.content:
<article>Don't miss out! Join us at our next Flagship Conference: KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North America in Atlanta (November 10-13). Connect with our current graduated, incubating, and sandbox projects as the community gathers to further the education and advancement of cloud native computing. Learn more at https://kubecon.io

Keynote: From Grass to Glass: Chitale Dairy's App Transformation with Kubernetes - Vishvas Parshuram Chitale, CEO Chitale Group & Dilpreet Bindra, Sr. Director, Engineering, Broadcom

Chitale Dairy digitized every aspect of operations by transitioning all software to modern containerized applications. Working with Sunfire, a Broadcom Advantage Partner, Chitale Dairy leveraged vSphere Kubernetes Service, a component in VMware Cloud Foundation, to accelerate their transformation. Infusing digital technology in every step of production the company also added a business-to-consumer delivery model at cloud speed.</article>
